detailsOfAchievement: SRC, Rayagada has been entrusted with the task of promoting adult literacy in the tribal areas of Odisha covering mostly, South Odisha districts, namely, Rayagada, Koraput, Nabarangpur, Malkangiri, Gajapati, Kandhamal, Boudh and Ganjam, where human development indicators are relatively lower and adult literacy rates are low specially amonge women. The main objectives of SRC is to provide academic resource support to those agencies who are associated with adult literacy initiatives and programmes by organizing training, developing producting teaching learning materials. SRC also carries out research and evaluation studies with reference to adult literacy. To provide resource support for establishment of a egalitarian society in which each according to his ability and each according to his needs. The gender, social and cultural barriers that women face will be taken into consideration while designing teaching learning programmes. Gender will not be seen in isolation but in conjunction with other social categories like caste, ethnicity, religion, disability, etc. Special priority will be given to women, belonging to SC, ST, minority and other disadvantaged groups in rural areas .The message would be conveyed so forcefully that the issue of literacy will become part of the social discourse and will motivate the non literates especially women to take part in learning , and the educated to voluntarily contribute to the programme. To provide academic support for 100% literacy in the tribal Areas of South Odisha. To help build an enabling environment for a knowledge society. To improve the quality of life of the tribal people through continuous learning process coupled with various skill development programmes. To achieve the target of Saakshar Bharat Programme initiated by the Government of India. To create a resource pool to prepare learning materials like; Primers, Bridge Primers, Posters. Booklets, Pamphlets, C.E Books. To impart teaching at different level at different level viz. G.P, Block, District and state.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: State Resource Centers are supposed to provide academic and technical resource support to literacy programmes. This has to be achieved through organizing training programmes, material development and production, publication, extension activities, innovative projects, research studies and evaluations.

detailsOfAchievement: Community level organizations are in place at thirty four villages to deal with social issues School management Committees have become active to children need of education With composite approach children get motivated for school education in ninety one schools Tribal children mainstream education program has reached out to more than ten thousand children Natural resource management process has advanced livelihood needs of tribal women Women have gained confidence as counterpart of development

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Initiative up scaled for mainstreaming of tribal children not attending schools and remain out of school Approach involves children accessing school and getting quality of learning Child protection and development addressed through multiple intervention Training of teachers and workers done for effective learning environment across schools and centers Stake holders including School Management Committees and Mothers Committees have shown positive response to the efforts of child development

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: SEED Division Department of Science and Technology
sourceOfFunds.purpose: Project has progressed in a systematic way with work plan and methodology followed at planning and implementation level Findings of consolidated and collated primary data were shared in community meetings of three operational villages which led to consensus building for identification of potential beneficiaries and modality of operation Livelihood groups have been formalized with memberships of one hundred twenty Other four livelihood groups are in process of formation at working villages level

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: SEED Division Department of Science and Technology
sourceOfFunds.purpose: Livelihood promotion of vulnerable families through skill refinement and product diversification in traditional bamboo craft Extending the process of collection and processing of leaves by women counterparts with value addition and marketing of the produces Ensuring active participation of community in Forest Right process for greater accessibility and control over minor forest produces supplementing existing livelihood system of people Sustainable livelihood system of the community in process

Project aims at mainstreaming of child education in vulnerable tribal pockets of the target area At the beginning of the project the children accessibility into school education remained poor having primitive ways of life of the tribal people making children to engage in work than attending school Composite approach of the project has enabled ninety five percent of children getting into preschool education as well as eighty three percent of school going children accessing into school education

Upscale of the initiative made for mainstreaming of vulnerable tribal children in schools The approach combines children accessing school and getting quality education Rights of children including protection were addressed through activation of Child Right Clubs Ensure better learning adaptability of children workers training on preschool education with Mothers Committee Members orientation have been streamlined School Management Committees have been trained on the positive response to schools

Composite measures initiated for promoting preschool education and mainstream education for vulnerable tribal children Training of Anganwadi workers SMCs members training have added more values to AWCs functioning as well as schools functioning Children attendance retention improved to a significant level Also supplementary teaching provided to children in classes with mixed tribal language groups have helped in greater extent to quality learning programmme Coverage of children has gone up

The Project aims at an integrated approach where community participates in improving social response for sound educational scenario in the vulnerable tribal area. Children enhance their right as part of Right to Education drive across the villages. Their participation in different co-curricular activities, promotion of skills and overall development have become essential elements in building child-friendly environment. Tribal villagers slowly developing their attitude towards educational need.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: SEED Division Department of Science and Technology
